qas.question: Who shot at the queen?
When was the shooting?

answers.text: not guilty by reason of insanity

qas.question: What disgruntled poet shot at Victoria's carriage on March 2, 1882?
What school did the boys who defended the Queen with umbrellas attend?

answers.text: he was found not guilty by reason of insanity

qas.question: What provoked the attack on Queen Victoria as she left Windsor?

answers.text: offended by Victoria's refusal to accept one of his poems

Who attempted to assassinate the Queen?

answers.text: not guilty by reason of insanity

qas.question: What position did Victoria take on being shot at?

answers.text: "worth being shot at—to see how much one is loved"

answers.text: refusal to accept one of his poems

context: On <a1_0><a18_0><b21_0>2 March <a6_0>1882<b21_0/><a18_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/>, <a0_0><a5_0><a10_0><a15_0><b20_0>Roderick Maclean<b20_0/><a15_0/><a10_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>, a disgruntled <a2_0><b22_0>poet<b22_0/><a2_0/> apparently <a13_0>offended by Victoria's <a19_0>refusal to accept one of his poems<a19_0/><a13_0/>, shot at the Queen as her carriage left Windsor railway station. <a7_0>Two schoolboys from <a3_0><a11_0><b23_0>Eton College<b23_0/><a11_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/> <a8_0>struck him with their <a4_0><b24_0>umbrellas<b24_0/><a8_0/><a4_0/>, until he was hustled away by a policeman. Victoria was <a14_0>outraged<a14_0/> when <a12_0>he was found <a9_0><a16_0>not guilty by reason of insanity<a16_0/><a12_0/><a9_0/>, but was so pleased by the many expressions of loyalty after the attack that she said it was <a17_0>"worth being shot at—to see how much one is loved"<a17_0/>.
